website_summaries.verdict: If you have your heart set on an electric-powered Sun Joe tiller and you want the best in terms of power, this is the one to get.
pros: The most powerful Sun Joe tiller on our list, and the 13.5 amps it delivers is enough to work most soil conditions and fairly large section of land
Blades span 16 inches and can chop soil down 8 inches deep
cons: Like most electric tillers, some very tough or rocky soil may be difficult for it to manage

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what all the fuss is about
customer_reviews.text: Used to break up some moderately stony soil, stopped working after about 10 minutes. Nothing too strenuous, so I was quite surprised. Not impressed. Contacted Sun Joe and was told my model (13.5 amp) was out of stock, so I could get a temp 12-amp tool or wait a month and half for the replacement 13.5 amp. I was fine with waiting. Six weeks came and went. Three followup emails to Sun Joe ignored over the next 6 weeks. So next year, I'll be looking for another tiller. No point in having a 'help' email if you aren't going to answer it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T.

customer_reviews.title: Mighty little machine!
customer_reviews.text: Great machine! I am a 5' woman that wanted something simple to use, easy to handle, but powerful enough to grind up our hard clay soil. This thing does it!! Easy to start, easy to use, light enough to carry or move around. I agree with other reviewers that it could use a larger trigger, but it's not so small that I'd knock a star off my review for it.
customer_reviews.author: CAFirst

customer_reviews.title: Did an excellent job! I wouldn't recommend adding extra weight to ...
customer_reviews.text: Did an excellent job! I wouldn't recommend adding extra weight to it because that could overload the motor. Just even if it jumps up and down a little, just live with it. We have tilled our large backyard, with hard soil and many small rocks and it has done wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Zan

customer_reviews.title: 4 big problems of design
customer_reviews.text: 4 big problems of design: It jumps a lot during using, so make sure to hold on tight. The wheels are too close, very easy to fall on the side. The blades are too close, very often the grass root get stuck into the blade shaft, it’s a pain to get it out. The manual says it can only be connected to cord less than 100 feet, this info was hided when I placed the order, so not fair :-(
customer_reviews.author: Qing Mu

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed to receive and find that this product is made in China. I would have gladly paid more for a product made in the USA or somewhere other than China! Amazon should make it clear on everything that they sell where the product is manufactured.
customer_reviews.author: retrade

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected. Wish I bought one sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical when I purchased this machine to till my raised vegetable beds and was thrilled when I used it for the first time. Since then I have tilled an entire hill filled with grass and clay to turn into a flowering meadow and it worked incredibly well. The best past is how light it is when trying to move it from one location to the next. Only downfall is that you really have to use your body to get it to go where you want. It's a workout, but still beats a shovel and rake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not light Weight and does not uproot old grass effectively
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to till my backyard and seed it again for new lawn. had a hard time using it. its a little heavy and does not till deep in the ground. you have to put some pressure and pull it backwards to go deep. Pulling it backwards while operating it hurts your shoulder a lot. And i had lot of roots from trees and some evergreen bush nearby the roots got stuck in the tiller and stopped it twice had to remove them and start it. All this to till a 200 sq foot area. And i have attached a picture of the tilled area which still has the crab grass intact. Extreme disappointment with this product
customer_reviews.author: Allwin

customer_reviews.title: Very good until it stopped running
customer_reviews.text: Sun Joe TJ604E 13.5 amp tiller. Stopped running after 1 season and 20 minutes. Worked well until then. It cuts fine through very heavy clay-rich soil. There are a couple of catches. The directions say that the "product may not be used to till extremely dry or wet soil," and you have to use a heavy-duty extension cord--14 gauge for up to 50 feet and 12 gauge for up to 100 feet. (I used a 12-gauge, 50-foot cord.) SunJoe is replacing it promptly with no hassles.
customer_reviews.author: Small Earth

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the 2 cycle Mantis and it is truly a great machine. But if you don't use it enough the maintenance will drive you crazy. I really needed this SunJoe 13.5 amp machine to work for grinding through hard pan in narrow trenches and mixing loam into hard packed clay topsoil. It does, no problem. And no hassle of mixing fuel or clogging carburetors. Just plug it in and press the trigger. That being said this is very light weight so all that power can bounce the machine around until you get used to it. Practice in the middle of your project and work to the edge. Mind the cord!
customer_reviews.author: SheriffDP

customer_reviews.title: Once I did that it did a great job. For the money it can't be beat
customer_reviews.text: It's a chewing little monster but light weight. I had to strap a bar of lead, about 40 pounds, to it to keep on the ground. Once I did that it did a great job. For the money it can't be beat. I have a 35 by 65 foot garden so it was just right although after I was done I felt like had been in a fight with a bear but any tiller would do that.
customer_reviews.author: gold miner

customer_reviews.title: garbage broke after three uses
customer_reviews.text: broke after three uses. you can hear the motor running but nothing is turning. complete garbage. avoid like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: Broke after about 45 minutes of use. Called product support, impossible to reach.
customer_reviews.text: We were using this to rototill our backyard - we used this correctly and it wasn't a particularly demanding task, but the rotor broke right off. We tried to call SunJoe product service and were on hold for an hour with no one picking up.
customer_reviews.author: Pecas

customer_reviews.title: When this came I took it out of the box immediately and got it outside and plugged in and man was I happy I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I was very apprehensive about buying this because I wasn't sure an electric tiller could do the job that I needed done. But I do not have much luck getting gasoline engines started so I thought I would give it a try. When this came I took it out of the box immediately and got it outside and plugged in and man was I happy I bought it. It does just as good as the small gasoline cultivator that I have used the past few years! Only I didn't have to go get gas and mix it will oil and pull and pull and pull to try to get it started! I am so incredibly happy with this purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: aimee750

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for 10 minutes, then tripped 20A breaker
customer_reviews.text: Rated as 13.5A power draw. Worked fine on 12AWG extension cord (as shown in directions) for the first ten minutes. Then it tripped the 20A breaker. Nothing else on the 20A circuit was on. Let it cool off, reset the breaker, and tried again. Took less time to trip the breaker again. Will return it. Disappointed, because I've had good luck with other Sun/SnowJoe products.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: good little tiller
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't try to till through sod but for any existing flower or vegetable bed, this works very well. Heavy roots will wind around it but you can remove two bolts and the blades come right off for proper cleaning. I needs a catch for the power button to keep it going without pulling the trigger but that is probably a safety thing. Hand gets tired. It takes a bit of muscle to use if you want to till deep. The lightweight electric motor doesn't dig down quite like a gas powered one. But it starts every time in the spring without cleaning carburetors. Really good for light to medium tilling.
customer_reviews.author: N. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: A real workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: Our larger ancient tiller broke just as we were starting a big gardening project. Repairing it would have cost more than buying a new one, so this was an opportune time to look for something lighter and smaller. This little tiller is a workhorse. It plows through heavy clay like a champ. We were also putting in new garden paths and this loosened the soil nicely so we could shovel it out with little struggle. Where has this been all my life? We will now get projects done that we’ve been putting off for years.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndia M.

customer_reviews.title: Broke second time using it.
customer_reviews.text: Tilled my garden fine in the fall. Got about halfway through in the spring and the whole tiller assembly broke. Mounts on with 4 bolts and it broke clean every one of them. Cheap metal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rugged maching
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough machine. It tears through 1/4 inch roots with ease. It will do larger roots with some encouragement. It is light weight so you have make up by putting more muscle into it, but I am really amazed at it. I did not have a problem with any of the set screws coming loose. I bought this the larger model because i knew that my yard had lots of roots. Worth the extra money for the top of the line. The only thing i wish for this tiller had a way of keeping the roots from wrapping around the tines. I spent a lot of time cutting the roots off the tines.
customer_reviews.author: 173rd Airborne Purple Heart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tiller for small to medium gardens
customer_reviews.text: This tiller performs flawlessly. It is much easier to handle than my Troy-Bilt Horse many years ago. I was able to till a new grass covered garden location to 4 to 6 inches deep the first pass. Second pass buried it to the deck easily. Pine tree roots were cut and pulled out, often wrapping around the tines, as can be expected. I finished the 10' by 25' garden in about 45 minutes, including clearing the tines. I'm amazed by this little tiller's abilities.
customer_reviews.author: ACTech47

customer_reviews.title: Good Tiller
customer_reviews.text: I have never operated a tiller until I bought this tiller. Was going to rent a gas tiller for $115 a day, then found this SunJoe tiller for about the same price, and I own this one. I am 5ft 100 lbs and could control this plug in electric machine. In the first garden, I spaded through my thick grass. This tiller busted that sod easily. On my next 3 beds, I put the tiller on the sod and it busted up hard clay, roots rocks go flying. I LOVE this tiller. I recommend it to EVERYONE.
customer_reviews.author: rwhite

customer_reviews.title: Powerful tool.
customer_reviews.text: I just tilled up the garden with my new Sun Joe TJ604E and was impressed. I did not know what to expect from an electric tiller but this thing chewed it up. I have slightly clay soil with small roots and there was no issues what so ever cutting through. It is the first tiller cultivator I have ever owned and it is a whole lot easier than the shovel. You do need to clean the tines when you are through to get the roots unwound. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: R. White

customer_reviews.title: Save money and buy this one...
customer_reviews.text: Save money and buy this one. Redoing a lawn? (Evenca small one)...No, getting the less powerful version of this thing is not gonna save you money. Getting this one will. The only thing to watch when using is long roots, leftover sod and similar items as the tines will need to be cleared every so often. Otherwise, It digs! And it made my nasty packed in soil (after removing weeds and sod) soft, mixed and dug up nicely preparing for new grass/sod. This will work for nearly any lawn or garden, but if you have a really small area that is not packed in dirt/clay/soil, and just top soil cultivation, maybe get the smaller version.
customer_reviews.author: Sideshow 535

customer_reviews.title: New to household, first run was pleasantly surprised at how well it went through our clay!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and used this spring for breaking ground in 2 small garden areas. Ran a double row of grassy undisturbed clay this little electric unit went through it like a dream! No problems for this little ground chewer! Done in minutes and easy to use, set up and put away. Lightweight but heavy duty enough to do the job! I can see this is going to be a great tool for years to come at my house!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting such a beast in so light a machine. Tore through hidden large pebbles, weed control fabric, turf & small shrub roots just fine. It does bounce. If so, don't go nuts forcing it to cut through. Work with it all around top & on side when you can. Very good value compared with every other option. I STILL want a 2 cycle Mantis, but I might never buy 1 if this lasts a couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Machinist Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Small Package Big Delivery
customer_reviews.text: If you're in the market for a tiller for your home products, look no further! I bought this to clean up some flower beds that had old mounds and plenty of fern roots, which are horrible to try n clean out. I didn't have super high expectations being it is small and electric but this machine tore through the ground and those fern roots in no time. One area was about 6' x 6' and 18" tall of just roots and it went through them like mushy spaghetti. Seriously if you have small or medium projects in your yard that need tilling, this will be more than worth the $120 investment.
customer_reviews.author: TFM68

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in gold
customer_reviews.text: Worth its weight in gold! Over the weekend, we used our new Sunjoe at least 12 hours and it exceeded our expectations! We are preparing a yard for sod where there used to be bushes, small trees and nasty vines. The Sunjoe couldn’t chew through the big roots nor did we expect it to. The smaller roots got twisted up in the tines and we had to stop and clear them out but totally understandable considering the ground we were dealing with. We had rented a heavy duty tiller the week before and had to do the same. We have a small family yard business and this guy already paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: HHT in Charleston

customer_reviews.title: Good work-pony!
customer_reviews.text: I like this garden tiller, but it is not a work-horse. It is powerful enough, but it is too light to easily handle hard soil. So anyway, I bought it to abuse it, and I am using it to help strip the top 4 inches of HARD soil off parts of my landscaping. And I have to keep it tightly controlled or it will bounce its way along instead of digging. but its doing the work I want, without me having to use pick and shovel tools. IMHO it would make easy work out of softer garden or flowerbed soil. And I haven't broken anything yet. It is a good work-pony. But not a plow-horse.
customer_reviews.author: old_rocketeer

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I used it to prep my yard for sod and wow! It’s lightweight, easy to maneuver, yet powerful. It tore up my rocky ground with ease and had 1200sq ft taken care of in about 30 min. I imagined I’d use this and sell it after but I love it so much, and for such a great price, I’m never letting this baby go! Buy one! You’ll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller for home use
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together and get started in the backyard. It worked great at digging up weeds/grass in clay soil. Watch out for rocks cause this will jump up when it hits one. It can chew through grass and weeds but make sure you mow them down first. I started going through some foot tall weeds and they immediately wrapped around the tines and bogged down the tiller. I had to use pliers to pull/break the weeds off. Once I made a pass over the weeds with the lawn mower, the tiller had no problem chewing up the dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Nolij

customer_reviews.title: This little sucker was surprisingly powerful. But as others ...
customer_reviews.text: This little sucker was surprisingly powerful. But as others have suggested it needs weight added. I took one of those leg weights from a shade canopy and slid it into the back area of the motor. Worked flawlessly. For the price, very hard to beat considering if I rented one it would cost about half of this price but I could not have the luxury of taking my time and doing the work as it was needed.
customer_reviews.author: RSG

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Pros Cost, durability, ease of use, power, low maintenance Cons Corded so it has potential to irritate at times I used this for simple jobs like tilling previously tilled corn patch as well as harder stuff like creating new beds cutting through grass/semi packed dirt. It is powerful enough and built well. Highly recommend putting two bricks or equal weight at bottom of handle. It provides enough weight to push it down and keep it from bumping around a ton. I’d buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S.

customer_reviews.title: A winner.
customer_reviews.text: Despite being electric this tool is a powerhouse. When used as directed it does all it claims right out of the box. Some YouTube videos claim you need to add weights, or a harness to better control the tiller. Again, follow instructions and you’ll do great. I tilled very rocky and soil with roots and it handled it. Some roots got caught up in the tines and required removal but that’s to be expected. This is well worth the money and beats the crap out of dealing with gas and oil.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Small Garden
customer_reviews.text: It kicks butt in my small garden, 3'x40'. The only gripe I have is that the extension cord is kind of a pain in the rear but is to be expected with electric yard tools unless you go with a model that has a battery pack. It's pretty light and easy to move around yet still doesn't have any problem tilling 6" or so deep. It does a good job cutting through small tree roots as well. Be prepared though to unplug it to clear the tines of roots once in a while. They seemed to get wrapped around the tines a bit. It was perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: This is the way, but get bright chord!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I hoped for. For me, I was tired of hoeing the ground by hand to get crabgrass and weeds out... my hands would hurt terribly and I knew there was a better way. This is it, this is the way. Only down side is it kicks up alot of dirt but that's expected of course. There's three levels by adjusting the wheel and the deepest level worked best on our backyard. I am completely new to this and I was able to assemble and operate quickly. Suggestion: get fluorescent extension chord: dirt flies and covers chord making it hard to see sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Christin Ornells

customer_reviews.title: Great Tiller for Smaller Areas
customer_reviews.text: I used this tiller to turn over small flowerbeds in the yard. For that purpose, it works perfectly with no complaints. It turns the soil over quickly and is easy to control. I would not utilize this tiller for large to very large areas. While it will still turn that soil over, it is not as powerful as a rear tine, counter-rotating gas tiller and would take much longer for very large areas. I don't utilize a tiller very often, so an electric tiller made perfect sense for me. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: FamilyGuy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Needed to tiller another section of lawn for soil aeration and reseeding. Previous rented a gas powered small tiller from a big box store. Cost and convenience (1/2 day) rental had me considering an alternative option. The choice was the TJ604E. Found it equally powerful to the gas one previously rented. Lighter in weight and equally effective, handled cleaning out dead grass, churning rocks and really aerating the soil. For the price of a 1/2 day rental now have my own tiller. Remember you need the proper extension cord, AMP and length.
customer_reviews.author: chw

customer_reviews.title: Superb product
customer_reviews.text: Great tiller, ripped through Georgia clay and weeds like a hot knife in butter. Spit the rocks out easily. Definitely helps to strap a cinder block on top with bungee cords. You'll get a great shoulder, arm and back work out guiding this thru your garden. I used it for a couple of hours, no over heating or any problems. Occasionally I got a large rock jammed but just knocked it out with a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Clay soil
customer_reviews.text: This might work for nice light garden soil, but it can't even get through the grass in my glay soil. Complete waste of money because I'll have to do most of the work by hand anyway.
customer_reviews.author: NevermoreFU

customer_reviews.title: Medium size and perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is awesome. Not a huge machine but the power and ease it has made for us is amazing. We have some tough dirt and this cut through it amazing. Only down side it doesn’t have a lock button to keep the machine on. Small flaw in such a perfect machine. I have rented a bigger gas power tiller before but it was heavy expensive and hard to move. This Sun Joe is perfect for home projects.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Really does the job
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had bought one years ago. Easy to assemble without any tools, works perfectly. The only thing that could improve it would be a variable speed trigger. It eats through sod and into soil very quickly. Just remember to work going backwards with a forward tine tiller. For the cost of a days rental I have a handy little tiller that REALLY does the job. No, it is not a full powered, rear tine tiller. Don't ask it to that kind of work, but use it wisely and it should perform for years. I use just as recommended, no added clamps or parts, no modifications whatsoever. I really am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. HOOVER

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing like tilling with a gas tiller, the tines spin so fast and with a lot of power. It's like a food processor for your soil. It chops the soil up so fine, even the clumps of sod you normally get are all chopped up into fine particles in the dirt. If you want to do a big area with it you need something to weight it down, because power to weight is high and it likes to jump around. Overall I love it, it's great for small garden and landscape jobs, highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Dobson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good - tills CLAY
customer_reviews.text: So far so good!! After 9 straight days of rain I broke my tiller out. My yard is mostly clay so I was afraid I might have to return but this joker handled it just fine. Yes, it is light weight and bounces if you do not hold it tightly and do not try to go too deep too soon - just let the tiller do the work and it is great. Gave it a four star review because it is corded - please put this power into a battery operated tiller someone / Sunjoe! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Bartlet

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little beast
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Snow Joe product that I buy. The first one being the lawn dethatcher. These products are fantastic especially for their very reasonable prices. Both of them work far better than expected. I am delighted with both of them. The roto-tiller has an amazing power and it is quiet!!
customer_reviews.author: frenchy

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I am totally surprised how well this tiller works. It was easy to assemble, and I had it running within 15 minutes after taking it out of box. I worked a 20 foot square area, about 400 square feet. It was much easier than using my old rear blade troy built tiller. After job was done it was pretty easy to clean up and had to remove grass that was wrapped around blades, but not too hard of a job. If Sun Joe will hold up over the next few years I will definitely be pleased. I would not hesitate to purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Beaty

customer_reviews.title: Only works on loose soil.
customer_reviews.text: The weight of the roto tiller could be the cause it jumping up when using on packed dirt. It works well in loose dirt It stopped working about half way through the job. We are returning it for our money back.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to till a small area that was too hard to use a shovel. Lots of hard dirt and rocks. Easily tilled the dirt and big and small rocks just popped up. Only one rock got stuck between the blades and the guard. Took a bit to get it out of there. Very powerful and easy to control.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Lefebvre

customer_reviews.title: Arrive incomplete - Missing piece - Company Fails to Respond.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived missing the nut holding the bolt to the wheel housing to the base unit... Awaiting the fix before I can use it. Been waiting for 2 weeks... SunJoe customer service - Hello???
customer_reviews.author: Booboo

customer_reviews.title: Better than I hoped
customer_reviews.text: We live in SE CO. The soil is rock shards in a matrix of shards of rock, bone dry and HARD. I have to soak about 5 gallons of water to dig a hole for a shrub. This tiller went thru it like butter and left a gorgeous fluffy loam in its wake. I put on a layer of organic rich $40/yd soil and another pass had it mixed in perfectly. We've been using this for a year now and I figured it was time to leave a review. Buy this- it's wonderful
customer_reviews.author: DRK

customer_reviews.title: Live Up to the Reputation
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to receive this tiller! I was able to assemble it in no time with a quick glance at the instructions. It really saved me a lot of time! It’s very strong and it helps that the blades are sharp. Follow the advice of other reviewers stating the need to cut the lawn as low as possible in order to keep long grass from wrapping around the blade mounts. GA red clay clumps around the base of the tiller. Other than that, I’m excited to have this very affordable time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: When this dies I will buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! 50something year old woman and put a garden in where it was just a yard before. Needed a slight modification to handle my clay soil by adding a concrete stepping stone for weight but worked it almost effortlessly, plus handled adding some straw into the new garden as well.
customer_reviews.author: c.adams

customer_reviews.title: Great addition and value for any garden or yard
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little machine. Especially here in Florida with our sandy soil. You can till a whole yard with minimal effort save for the periodic cleaning of the blades for centipede grass. Great for gardeners. A nice little benefit is this machine is exactly as wide as a piece of sod.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical of electric tiller. Couldn't have been more wrong. This thing works so well and is easy to use. I did my front yard landscaping in 3 hours. Little hint, you dont need to keep the button held down on the right handle. Didnt figure that out until I was almost done. Very happy with this purchase. Will use this tiller often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Like This Tiller
customer_reviews.text: I used to own a Sears 5 hp tiller that was good but way to big and hard to handle. This little tiller does almost as good a job and I don't have to worry about gas, oil, spark plugs, air filter, etc. The tiller will bury itself a good 8 in. into the soil if you let it. Great for garden and flower beds around the house. Only slightly negative thing I can think of is that the width is not adjustable so tilling between plants is limited.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to till up ground where I had dug up bushes in front of may house. It does a good job. You do need to buy a heavy duty electric cord to handle the 13.5 amps. So figure that into your purchase. If you are digging up a place with a lot of roots, the roots will wrap around and you will need a small hand saw to cut them out. The area I was doing was completely root bound, so it was an unusual situation. For just tilling up a flower bed or vegetable garden it would work great.
customer_reviews.author: Edward H. Beazley

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t put it together, so I cannot comment on how easy or difficult it was to assemble. That said, I’m so happy with how this machine operates...it has saved me hours and hours of backbreaking work. I wasn’t quite sure what to expect but it’s done what I thought and then some. It brings roots (and other undesirables) closer to the surface and loosens them up so they are easier to remove and while I’ll probably lose the sharpness of the blades very quickly, my mess of a garden has become way easier to manage. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Susanna

customer_reviews.title: Super powerful, great price
customer_reviews.text: I've used rear-tine gas powered roto-tillers many times in the past. I wasn't expecting too much with a much smaller front-tine electric tiller. Boy, was I wrong. This tiller is a beast. It went into hard compacted soil without any problem and no overheating. Super easy to assemble (about 5 minutes) and just one switch to operate. I was definitely tired the next day. I wouldn't recommend on completely dry hard soil. I used mine on slightly moist hard, compacted soil and it worked great. Given the very low priced, I'd definitely recommend for almost any gardener.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Clam

customer_reviews.title: Works, but dirt goes everywhere. No speed control.
customer_reviews.text: Once I tilled my raised beds, I had to come back with a rake and shovel to put the dirt back into it. Otherwise, easy to handle, light and really like being able to stop anytime and start right back up. No fueling, no oil, but you need a good 12/3 extension cord. If you plan on tilling up sod, WRONG machine. If it had a half speed, it would be nice. If your working damp clay or plant matter, it will clog up and takes forever to clean out.
customer_reviews.author: JL_Farmer

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've only done about 200 sqft out of 2000 so far. But it really is doing a nice job. I'm getting about 6" deep in PNW valley soil without much issue. There is a bit of technique to it. I'm in the medium wheel setting. I let it ride forward on the wheels so it doesn't bounce and pull it back to me, a few times like this and you're down 6". It's doing this in a yard with good soil, but lots of weeds and some crabgrass and small cobble.
customer_reviews.author: Ed willson

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor had one of these and loaned it too me to use as we were putting in a butterfly garden. She told me I could continue to borrow it whenever I wanted, but what I wanted was to buy my own, right then and there after about two hours of use. This thing works awesomely and being electric doesn't do a lot of noisy gas smelling messy gasoline roto tiller. It is truly powerful and digs deep with little effort. I guess what shocked me the most was how inexpensive it was.
customer_reviews.author: Kumara

customer_reviews.title: Good equipment!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t buy this, my husband did. I thought it would break or be weak since it’s, in my mind, inexpensive. It has worked amazingly well and we tilled A LOT of land. We also found a piece of carpet and before we identified it, it got wrapped up in the blades, so I thought we were done. However, we were pretty easily able to cut it out/unwind the inappropriate material and it was completely fine...working like a pro again.
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Was not sure about an electric tiller but I thought I’d give it a try. It is light weight and it does bounce around a bit but once you get the ground busted up it’s ok. Did a good job for me and the ground was hard packed and very rocky. Attached picture of the rocks this tiller actually dug up. So far this has been very good to me and does what I need it to do. Was very easy to put together. About 20 minutes. Happy so far. Joseph from Texas
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Will change your gardening experience!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a powerhouse. And so easy to assemble. I was deterred from having a vegetable garden in my backyard for a few reasons. The Bermuda grass in our hard clay soil for one. The cost to buy soil to build raised beds for two. This thing solved everything. I can get rid of the crazy grass and utilize my natural fertile soil. It's still a workout but it makes the job a million times easier. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy W

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I was a little skeptical that an electric tiller could accomplish much. I was pleasantly surprised. It handled a garden area (8x20) well (already tilled in previous years), and it handled breaking up never tilled ground (6x10). Getting used to managing a cord has been the hardest part. Not having to mix gas/oil is nice, and not smelling like exhaust after is great. For smaller tilling jobs, I recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I have been putting off some gardening projects due to not having a tiller. I am on up in the years and did not want another gas powered tool to have to maintain. I have used it several times this summer and more than happy with the results. Some areas were hard clay that has never been turned over. The tiller had sufficient torque and motor power to pull through. The best part for me is doing a little clean up of the machine, putting away the cord and tiller and done. I will continue to look for Sun Joe products for other lawn and garden needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ron I Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: works better going backwards
customer_reviews.text: going forward it does not want to get deep in the dirt. but when i go backwards it does the job. so now when i use it i walk backwards. it works to a degree but i think i am going to go with a bigger and heavier model.
customer_reviews.author: Rogue viper

customer_reviews.title: It Will Dig!
customer_reviews.text: I like the size, weight and power. Great for a small garden or flower beds. Will have trouble with hard packed soil as all tillers do. Ran hard for a good while, never bogged down or quit. I've found the best way to use is pull it backwards and let it do it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Barbv

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe TJ604E is a Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how well this little tiller worked. It's light, and cuts through old grass and weeds like a knife through soft butter. Easy to assemble. Plenty of power. I am over 60, so I know it is perfect for small projects. It bounces a bit here and there. You got to clean out the tines every so often. Have a bit of tea and its ready to go. I love the adjustable wheels too. So easy to set up. I would recommend it for its attended use.
customer_reviews.author: mLehmer

customer_reviews.title: The best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best item ever purchased was cheaper than renting and it crushed the dirt like it was a pile of Sand , I listened to the reviews and they all said the 13.5 amp was way better than the 12 amp so they were correct perfect item for a garden , I used it to mix my clay soil with top soil to plant my new sod in my front yard. Thank you Sun Joe
customer_reviews.author: UBME

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to till hardpacked soil where I wanted to plant grass. I tried to do it manually with a rake and hoe, but the ground was too hard - it was taking forever. This tiller took about 15-20 minutes to set up and I was able to till the whole area in less than an hour. I was very impressed - it easily dug down into the dirt and was more powerful than I expected. I lent it to a friend who was so impressed that she's buying her own.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: More power than expected from an electric tiller.
customer_reviews.text: This has way more power than I expected from an electric tiller! It did a great job turning over the ground in the flower bed I had just ripped out some very woody stemmed plants. The reason I didn’t give five stars is you have to keep your finger on the button to keep the blades moving. I may be wrong but I couldn’t figure out how to have it on continuously and just hold the handles. It just got kind of awkward. It’s very light weight so it’s very easy to maneuver. I’m very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: aly 0905

customer_reviews.title: Wicked Cool!!!
customer_reviews.text: I put this together today, in around 20 minutes, it ran fantastic. I beat it like you can't believe, it can take a beating. I dug up roots, rocks, two boulders we had to remove with 5 foot bars and shovels. I took it all in stride, just kept on going. If I kill it I will buy another one for sure. I had a 100 foot 10ga electric cable and a 50 foot 12ga to get power to it and they worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Harper

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for Lightweight Tool
customer_reviews.text: Like many reviews, I was amazingly surprised how well this worked for how lightweight the unit is. It’s been used so many times already this summer by myself but mostly by my neighbor. And because of the low price, if he breaks it (because he’s been pretty much using it daily for a week) it won’t cost too much for him to replace. You do have to stop often if tilling where there a lot of roots.
customer_reviews.author: F. H. Legaspi III

customer_reviews.title: It don't work
customer_reviews.text: This product came yesterday night. I opened it today. I had a little bit damaged in packaging, but the things inside looked good. There was little dirt on the wheel, which was surprising. When I used it right now, the machine doesn't work and don't know who to contact. Amazon is not picking up my phone at this time. Please help.
customer_reviews.author: Shikhar K.

customer_reviews.title: great for smaller jobs
customer_reviews.text: I used it for a 10' x 20' patch where the swingset was to prep for reseeding. Digs down a couple of inches so it might not be good for a garden but fine for grass. Cut through existing sod easily. Got clogged in the really nasty clay, but spun up the dirt quickly and easily. Blades turn faster than I expected - guessing at 240rpm instead of 60rpm (didn't measure it or see it specified anywhere) but that number may be way off. I'm pleased and plan to use next to clear a new flower bed around the house.
customer_reviews.author: cpinvt

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but makes you work for it.
customer_reviews.text: I just have a small area of numerous 1.5 m by 5 m beds to till and it works for fine that scenario. I wouldn't recommend it for anything much larger unless you want to combine your gym workouts with gardening. I'm not a small nor weak guy and I find it quite the workout if I have to do more than 3 or 4 beds in the same day. I would think if a smaller person could rig up a harness it would be a little easier. It seems the best way to till is by pulling the unit backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that because it was electric it wouldn't be able to do as well as a gas tiller. Wrong. It did a great job tearing through new construction dirt. I dug up several rocks, it just kind of tossed them and kept going and I would stop to collect the rocks now and then. This is a great value for anyone who gardens but doesn't want to spend several hundred dollars for a tiller.
customer_reviews.author: Ronin21788

customer_reviews.title: With modifications it is an amazing machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: I read a number of reviews on here and decided to modify it per the recommendations from the get-go: Mod 1: hose clamps next to all connections for the handle (4 total next to each screw in attachment) Mod 2: Landscape block placed behind the motor and in front of the handle. I used this thing for 1600sqft of tilling sod and then mixing in amendments; it did an amazing job, especially for the price. Would highly recommend for a small versatile tool that can handle bigger projects.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical that this little tiller would work on the hard red clay in my Virginia yard, but it did. I wish I had bought this a year ago when I moved to my new house. See the photos for the section that I tilled. It did bounce a bit especially when I hit old tree roots or rocks, but the machine kept going and an hour later I had tilled up the clay into a nice shrub bed for planting. Can't wait to use this in other sections of my yard. I would highly recommend this tiller.
customer_reviews.author: HOaKIE84

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller, easy to use! No more messing with fuel or fouled spark plugs!
customer_reviews.text: Was Worried about buying an electric tiller but didn’t want to mess around with fuel or spark plugs... was wanting a easy to use tiller for my garden (40x120) The ground sat unused for a few years and I started dumping manure over it last year.. this tiller was very impressive grinding everything up and mixing the older soil with the manure. The tiller was easy to assemble, just needed to add the handle bar. I would and have recommended this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Value For dollars Spent  Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing has some serious power! I bought it to fix bad spots in my yard that needed to be reseeded. I didn’t want a gas one because I won’t use it often and gas would gum up the engine sitting around not being used for a while. **Tip** Don’t try tilling while going forward. I tap the trigger on and off walking the blades to the edge of where I want to till and than till pulling it backwards. Once I get to the back edge I let the blades ride on the surface and tap the on/off slowing walking it back forward for another pass. A lot easier on your body this way!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Zerka

customer_reviews.title: It tills!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a good tiller for existing flower beds. It handled itself well chewing through grass clumps and some 3" flagstone pieces that reside in my topsoil without hesitating. Much easier than a shovel! Now, will this till a lawn? I think it is too light to do it quickly, but with patience and pacing ( the machine would probably get hot ) you could get it done in sections.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kingsbury

customer_reviews.title: Green Monster
customer_reviews.text: This machine is incredible! The large rocks it finds and removes is impressive. From time to time, if the stone is thin enough, will jam up the blades. Not to worry, just use a mallet and steel rod on the stone back in the direction from which it came. I’ve used this a few times already. What used to take hours by shovel is now reduced 75%.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised +
customer_reviews.text: MANEUVERABILITY is 5 star that comes from the users ability to adapt to the product, but the other 2 areas are slam dunks. If something works as advertised I would normally give it 4*, but this tool is above and beyond and truly worthy of 5*.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer  Average Larry

customer_reviews.title: This thing is just a wonderful surprise. I originally purchased to use in my ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just a wonderful surprise. I originally purchased to use in my raised garden beds but found myself seeking out other tasks around the home. Far as difficulty level, the best I can describe is the pull of a small to medium size dog on a leash and about the weight of a vacuum cleaner. I did find that working up a lawn for a garden will take a couple of swipes back and forth to get the depth and consistency that you're looking for, but it has the power to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Zehnder

customer_reviews.title: Great device, no gas to worry about.... but
customer_reviews.text: It looks to do a great job. I'm planning on using it today. I was forced to buy a 100 ft 12 gauge extension cord for $70 which raised the cost of my project substantially. The device needs a higher gauge (thicker) cord to prevent overheating which is not covered under warranty. If you use less than 50 ft, a standard 14 gauge cord works, but I needed over 50 ft and that requires a much more heavy duty cord or risk burning out the unit which is not warranty covered.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spinner

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't impressed
customer_reviews.text: Used for maybe a minute and managed to get a rock stuck. Busted a bolt and had to disassemble. First time using and haven't used it since. Seems to be cheaply designed. Clearly made for non-rocky terrains.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SunJoe TJ604E does all the work for you!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I purchased the SunJoe TJ604E!! I am no longer able to turn the soil by hand, and this tool did all of the work for me. I went with the electric model because it is quieter, cleaner and more reliable than a gas model. With my 100 foot cord, I have no problem reaching areas of my garden. I recommend this product for your gardening needs!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Kuppler

customer_reviews.title: Tiller
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing the other reviews I purchased this tiller. I will tell you..wait for the ground to be dry or minimally wet. I was anxious in the thaw to get to work, The tiller did its part, but it was a lot of work to clean it afterwards. After I use this tiller I make the time for cleaning. But it works well for what it is. Renting a large machine was just not going to do it for me. So I purchased this machine and I'm happy with it given the cost and what I've accomplished so far,
customer_reviews.author: Colin Yorke

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: It worked amazing for 30 minutes then it stopped working idk why called to the company and wait time was two minutes sat on the phone for almost an hour and got nobody so I sent an email n now I have to wait 48 hours to get a response back.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Palomares

customer_reviews.title: Love this tiller!
customer_reviews.text: I do not have a lot of upper body strength and I was afraid I would not be able to use a tiller that had any real power. We have very hard clay soil with a lot of large rocks. Well this tiller surprised me!.. Very easy to assemble, light weight but plenty of power. It chopped up the hard clay and rocks with ease. Super easy to use, clean and move around. The handle folds and makes storing it convenient and space saving. Very happy with this tiller!
customer_reviews.author: ronnie

customer_reviews.title: This machine is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and it was very easy for him to put together. Price was so right he couldn't believe it would work like it said it would BUT.....he took it into the backyard and started tilling and, oh my gosh, it did the job and then some. Worked perfectly. Tilled up entire backyard in one day and it's a good sized backyard. Tilled thru rocks and heavy dirt and he is so happy he bought this. Easy to use too.
customer_reviews.author: JAY

customer_reviews.title: Quit Working after 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Started digging a little bed for strawberries, and 5 minutes later it quit working. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: James in the woods

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I need a power washer for home use and found this one to be great for the price. I have had it about a year now and used it to clean the deck, my house siding, and my sidewalks. No complaints. Came quickly and works great. I did have to ready the instructions, but they were pretty good. My daughter uses it too. Glad we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan T. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: More ppwerful than expected!
customer_reviews.text: One use only, but very impressed. I was disappointed when i unboxed it, its tiny! No way is this going to rip through grass and roots... well, it does! Moving forward, chews up the surface, pulling back it digs in nicely. Did about 200sqft of new england hard packed lawn in about 15-20min. At least 5 of that was unjamming a rock. Thats the only negative, you cant counter rotate the blades to release a rock. But, it was a fist sized rock, small ones were no issue.
customer_reviews.author: megaladon

customer_reviews.title: Strong little dude
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to roto till front yard for sod replacement. It worked like a champ! The price is very reasonable for this powerful machine. It tilled right through packed clay all morning. Was really really pleased. It did its job with ease. Heads up - this is a CORD electric tiller. I thought it was electric battery cordless. But, as it turned out we used 2 extension cords and never had to worry about battery running down. Upon using it would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny !!
customer_reviews.text: The choice was the landscaper for $700 or buy Sun Joe for $119. It was a great choice. I tilled a large piece of semi-soft packed dirt very quickly. Then went over it a second time, the earth looks ready for the grass seed. The biggest issue would be that I had to stop and move the cord or get the cord unstuck from something. Don't hesitate to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: What a great product it really gets the job done vary quickly. I have a old gas powered rototiller but the carburetor needs to be rebuilt. So instead I bought this I will never have that problem again. It has great torque for such a little machine. Now I admit my area is not that big and not vary tough soil but it whipped it out in no time. Great tiller for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jason schellenberg

customer_reviews.title: Tough little Tiller helped me dig through dense clay
customer_reviews.text: What a useful garden tool for anyone that needs to dig through a significant amount of soil, especially clay. got this 13.5-amp version thinking it would be powerful enough and it certainly is. Was able to dig a long garden bed and also areas where we have planted lines of bushes. Electric was a concern but so thankful we did not get a messy gas powered model.
customer_reviews.author: electriccafe

customer_reviews.title: This little guy is a WORKHORSE!
customer_reviews.text: Really chews up the ground quickly. It was pretty weed infested, so the tines clogged up with weed stems wrapped around the tine shaft. Kind of a bear to remove them. Works quickly and softens the ground to about 6" deep for easy planting.... REALLY NICE
customer_reviews.author: RonK Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Little Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile and compact. It just cut through roots or pulled them up to the surface so I could cut them out. The manual includes an extensive list of safety precautions, and read it and obey them thoroughly. The motor is powerful and the sharp blades will cause severe bodily injury if this machine is not used carefully. It is a nice tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Sun Joe TJ604E 16-Inch 13.5 AMP Electric Garden Tiller/Cultivator,Black
product_meta.description: THE DIRTY LITTLE SECRET OF GREAT GARDENS. Experience the one tiller that’s truly up to the task! Introducing a greener, cleaner way to get dirty with the Sun Joe TJ604E Electric Tiller Cultivator. A powerful 13.5-amp motor quickly pulverizes dirt, effortlessly slicing through the soil at 370 RPM, ensuring maximum aeration and perfectly preparing the seedbed for planting. Cultivate an area 16-inches wide and up to 8-inches deep in seconds. Control weeds where needed - Sun Joe tames the toughest yard and garden tasks with more comfort and less strain. 3-position, height-adjustable rear wheels make it easy to maneuver wherever it’s needed - and its collapsible handle makes it a cinch to store when it’s not. The TJ604E comes with a full two-year warranty.
feature_bullets: Powerful: 13. 5-Amp motor cultivates up to 16 in. Wide x 8 in. Deep
Durable: 6 Steel angled tines for maximum durability and performance
Easy storage: handle folds for convenient storage and easy transport

We’ve got you covered! : your new Tiller + cultivator is backed by the snow Joe + Sun Joe customer promise. We will warrant New, powered products for two years from the date of purchase. No questions asked. Contact snow Joe + Sun Joe customer Support at 1-866-766-9563 for further assistance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,336 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
